Musings on the Subject of Amy's Innocence: Being who I am (Gina--Great Knower of All Things Worth Knowing and Some Things Apparently Not Worth Knowing Until You Know Them and Then Come to Realize That They Were Truly Worth Knowing All Along), I know the truth. Amy is indeed innocent. Yes, it's true, she really is as innocent as she claims to be. On the surface, that is. However, deep down, the inner machinations of Amy's mind are anything but innocent. She would never tell anyone the debaucheries she of which she dreams--seducing a man she just met at a sleezy bar, taking him home, tying him down, and having her way with him, all whilst dressed as a giant banana. Yes, she may appear and act innocent and pure, but her thoughts dwell in a dirty, naughty gutter that is anything but. Musings on the Subject of Llamas: I express my deepest thanks to the owner of the Red Room Which is not Really Red for her support in my great Llama Literation campaign. As for Amy's views on llamas, some of them are indeed antisocial. These poor creatures suffer from a wide variety of psychological maladies, due in part to their lack of reading abilties. Another contributing factor is the long year of oppression their species has suffered, being used as meer pack animals. Donkies have suffered the same, but have the status of their cousin, the horse to comfort them. Camels have been rehabilitated in zoos and given the honor of making many a child happy. Llamas have no such comfort. They are bitter. Also a source of much bitterness and a contributing factor to their unhappiness is the alpaca. The alpaca is very similar to the llama, but for some reason has gained more attention, even having their own television commercial. Having suffered such oppression and living in such obscurity, it is only natural that the llama would be a bitter, unhappy animal. People have not been kind to the llama. I hope you shall take this to heart and bear the antisocial llama no ill will. I shall end my musings here, for now. I could easily continue with the subject of cookies and beavers, but I shan't for I grow weary of time and grow frightened of my own musings. But rest assured I shall return soon to enlighten and terrify all of you. :) Until then, I eagerly await the offering of cookies and ponder precisely what else Mr. Brick is planning on making...
